TypeSignature.Value: .class public interface auto ansi abstract ISession

Docs.summary: Defines the interface to establish a shared context among parties that exchange messages by providing an ID for the communication session.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.ISession> interface is the base interface for all sessions. It contains a <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.ISession.Id%2A> property for identifying the session.
A session is a shared context among all participants in a communication exchange. This shared context is characterized by the following three properties:
- Session establishment - a process for establishing shared context among all participants.
- Message correlation - a method for correlating a group of messages to an instance of shared context.
- The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.ISession> interface is not informed as to the number of participants in a session or the lifetime of a session.
These session properties are provided by associating an ID with a session.
<xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.ISession> is inherited by:
- <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.IInputSession>
- <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.IOutputSession>
- <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.IDuplexSession>
- <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.ISessionChannel%601> of type <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.ISession>

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Id As String
public: property System::String ^ Id { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the ID that uniquely identifies the session.
Docs.value: The ID that uniquely identifies the session.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If the session is interrupted, it can be retrieved using the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.ISession.Id%2A>.
